page.title: 12EDUCATION IN OFFLEY.
page.content: Offley School was established as long ago as 1841, subsequent to the creation of a Trust Fund by Dame Sarah Salusbury of Offley Place and the Reverend Lynch Burroughs, Vicar of Offley. Early this century, responsibility for the maintenance of the educational functions was taken over from the Church by the Hertfordshire County Council and later, in implementation of the 1944 Education Act the School was re-organised as a Junior Mixed and Infants School. The School is now controlled by Governors nominated respectively by the Diocese of St. Albans, Offley Parochial Church Council and Hertfordshire County Council. This year the children from the neighbouring village of Lilley, their own school having closed, became pupils of Offley School.
